00021 /*! \file
00022  *
00023  * \brief DNS SRV Record Lookup Support for Asterisk
00024  *
00025  * \author Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com>
00026  * 
00027  * \arg See also \ref AstENUM
00028  *
00029  * \note Funding provided by nic.at
00030  */
00031 
00032 #include "asterisk.h"
00033 
00034 ASTERISK_FILE_VERSION(__FILE__, "$Revision$")
00035 
00036 #include <sys/types.h>
00037 #include <netinet/in.h>
00038 #include <arpa/nameser.h>
00039 #ifdef __APPLE__
00040 #if __APPLE_CC__ >= 1495
00041 #include <arpa/nameser_compat.h>
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 #include <resolv.h>
00045 #include <stdio.h>
00046 #include <string.h>
00047 #include <unistd.h>
00048 
00049 #include "asterisk/channel.h"
00050 #include "asterisk/logger.h"
00051 #include "asterisk/srv.h"
00052 #include "asterisk/dns.h"
00053 #include "asterisk/options.h"
00054 #include "asterisk/utils.h"
00055 
00056 #ifdef __APPLE__
00057 #undef T_SRV
00058 #define T_SRV 33
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 struct srv {
00062    unsigned short priority;
00063    unsigned short weight;
00064    unsigned short portnum;
00065 } __attribute__ ((__packed__));
00066 
00067 static int parse_srv(char *host, int hostlen, int *portno, unsigned char *answer, int len, unsigned char *msg)
00068 {
00069    int res = 0;
00070    struct srv *srv = (struct srv *)answer;
00071    char repl[256] = "";
00072 
00073    if (len < sizeof(struct srv)) {
00074       printf("Length too short\n");
00075       return -1;
00076    }
00077    answer += sizeof(struct srv);
00078    len -= sizeof(struct srv);
00079 
00080    if ((res = dn_expand(msg, answer + len, answer, repl, sizeof(repl) - 1)) < 0) {
00081       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to expand hostname\n");
00082       return -1;
00083    }
00084    if (res && strcmp(repl, ".")) {
00085       if (option_verbose > 3)
00086          ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "parse_srv: SRV mapped to host %s, port %d\n", repl, ntohs(srv->portnum));
00087       if (host) {
00088          ast_copy_string(host, repl, hostlen);
00089          host[hostlen-1] = '\0';
00090       }
00091       if (portno)
00092          *portno = ntohs(srv->portnum);
00093       return 0;
00094    }
00095    return -1;
00096 }
00097 
00098 struct srv_context {
00099    char *host;
00100    int hostlen;
00101    int *port;
00102 };
00103 
00104 static int srv_callback(void *context, unsigned char *answer, int len, unsigned char *fullanswer)
00105 {
00106    struct srv_context *c = (struct srv_context *)context;
00107 
00108    if (parse_srv(c->host, c->hostlen, c->port, answer, len, fullanswer)) {
00109       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to parse srv\n");
00110       return -1;
00111    }
00112 
00113    if (!ast_strlen_zero(c->host))
00114       return 1;
00115 
00116    return 0;
00117 }
00118 
00119 int ast_get_srv(struct ast_channel *chan, char *host, int hostlen, int *port, const char *service)
00120 {
00121    struct srv_context context;
00122    int ret;
00123 
00124    context.host = host;
00125    context.hostlen = hostlen;
00126    context.port = port;
00127 
00128    if (chan && ast_autoservice_start(chan) < 0)
00129       return -1;
00130 
00131    ret = ast_search_dns(&context, service, C_IN, T_SRV, srv_callback);
00132 
00133    if (chan)
00134       ret |= ast_autoservice_stop(chan);
00135 
00136    if (ret <= 0) {
00137       host[0] = '\0';
00138       *port = -1;
00139       return ret;
00140    }
00141    return ret;
00142 }
